subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit considered problematic
msgSnippet: If I had $2M in the bank I wouldn t bother with programming for money. Until that time comes... Unless you plan to add proper DBC support to Java, please find
messageBody:
If I had $2M in the bank I wouldn't bother with programming for money. Until that time comes...

Unless you plan to add proper DBC support to Java, please find another argument.

Thanks.

>So said Mike Clark on 4/2/2003 --------------------
>javainsel wrote:
>
>>I am not satisfied with the JUnit and TDD "paradigma". They are
>>originated because of a *poverty* in Java programing language. If
>>Java would support proper Design by Contract and a compiler for that
>>than no one would bother with JUnit and TDD.
>>
>>
>
>In the meantime, a significant amount of commercial software is being
>written in Java.
>
>Mike
>
>--
>Mike Clark
